generation

Class MazeFactoryTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • generation.MazeFactoryTest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MazeFactoryTestEller

    public class MazeFactoryTest
extends java.lang.Object

    MazeFactoryTest tests the validity of a maze. The black-box nature of the testing means that only the end state of the maze is subject to testing; intermediary details are unknown.

    JUnit params (org.junit.jupiter.params) is used to automate application of test cases to mazes of variable difficulty levels.

    Author:
    Elijah Mas

    • Method Detail

      • establishMazes

        public void establishMazes(int level,
                           boolean deterministic)

        Create a perfect maze and an imperfect maze to subject to the different test methods; the level parameter allows for a variable maze level.

        This method calls runAllTests(int), allTests(), and baselineTests(). The hierarchy of calls allows for simple extension into subclasses.

        Parameters:
        level - the level of the maze
        deterministic - whether or not the maze is generated deterministically

      • runAllTests

        @ParameterizedTest
 @ValueSource(ints={0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8})
public void runAllTests(int level)

        This method might be considered a stand-in "main" method for this class. It automates the execution of other methods that contain assert* statements but are not marked with the @Test annotation; the reason for doing this is that this method uses the @ParameterizedTest annotation, which allows all the other methods to be run with variable input arguments, which the plain @Test annotation does not permit. The parameter values (@ValueSource) are a series of integers that represent the different difficulty levels of puzzles involved that will be tested.

        Call hierarchy
        The following tests are performed:

        • allTests()
          • baselineTests()
            • testNoRoomsInPerfectMaze(): test that a perfect maze has no rooms.
            • testOneExitByBorders(): test that a maze has only one missing border around the periphery.
            • testExitAtExpectedLocation(): test that the exit location identified by a maze matches that which is detected by examining other maze properties.
            • testOneExitByDistance(): test that only one maze cell has a distance of 1 to the exit.
            • testMaxDistanceStartingPoint(): test that the starting point has the maximal distance to the exit of all cells in the maze.
            • testEveryCellHasExit() test that every cell has neighbors at distance=1 away and with no floorboards in between, which allows us to conclude that every cell in the maze can access the exit.
          • deterministicTest ensure that the seed of the random number generator is the same before each deterministic maze order.


        Each one of these tests is run at the specified difficulty levels (currently 0-8); at each difficulty level we run all the above tests (save for testNoRoomsInPerfectMaze()) for two cases:

        1. a perfect maze
        2. an imperfect maze
        As implied by the name, testNoRoomsInPerfectMaze() is run only for a perfect maze.

        Parameters:
        level - the difficulty level of the maze

      • deterministicTest

        public void deterministicTest(boolean deterministic)
        When deterministic maze generation is requested, this method asserts that the seed value of the random generator matches the expected value.
        Parameters:
        deterministic - whether the deterministic order has been placed

      • allTests

        public void allTests()
        For MazeFactoryTest, allTests() runs only baselineTests(). In subclasses, this can be overrode to introduce new tests.

      • baselineTests

        public void baselineTests()
        baselineTests() runs these tests:
        testNoRoomsInPerfectMaze()
        testOneExitByBorders()
        testExitAtExpectedLocation()
        testOneExitByDistance()
        testMaxDistanceStartingPoint()
        testEveryCellHasExit()

      • testOneExitByDistance

        public void testOneExitByDistance()
        Calls getMazeExitsByDistance(Maze) on both perfect and imperfect mazes and verifies that the call returns a list containing only one cell.

      • testOneExitByBorders

        public void testOneExitByBorders()
        Calls getMazeExitsByBorders(Maze) on both perfect and imperfect mazes and verifies that the call returns a list containing only one cell.

      • getMazeExitsByDistance

        protected java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getMazeExitsByDistance(Maze maze)
        Iterating over all cells in the maze, return a list that contains all cells that have distance=1 from the exit. ***Expected result: the list should have only one cell.
        Parameters:
        maze - a maze created by a MazeBuilder instance
        Returns:
        the cells in the maze whose distance to the exit is 1

      • testExitAtExpectedLocation

        public void testExitAtExpectedLocation()
        call _testExitAtExpectedLocationByDistance(Maze) and _testExitAtExpectedLocationByBorders(Maze) on both perfect and imperfect mazes. Asserts that the exit cell identified in the maze's exit cell is where expected based on distances and borders.

      • _testExitAtExpectedLocationByDistance

        protected boolean _testExitAtExpectedLocationByDistance(Maze maze)

        Get the exit cell identified by getMazeExitsByDistance(Maze) and compare it with the cell returned by Maze.getMazedists().getExitPosition()

        ***Expected result: these cells are the same.
        Parameters:
        maze - a Maze instance
        Returns:
        the result of the comparison; true indicates success

      • _testExitAtExpectedLocationByBorders

        protected boolean _testExitAtExpectedLocationByBorders(Maze maze)

        Get the exit cell identified by getMazeExitsByBorders(Maze) and compare it with the cell returned by Maze.getMazedists().getExitPosition()

        ***Expected result: these cells are the same.
        Parameters:
        maze - a Maze instance
        Returns:
        the result of the comparison; true indicates success

      • getMazeExitsByBorders

        protected java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getMazeExitsByBorders(Maze maze)
        Iterating over all cells in the maze, return a list that contains all cells with a missing border wall on the maze's external periphery. If a cell has two missing border walls (this only could happen for a corner cell), the cell is added twice. ***Expected result: the list should have only one, non-duplicated cell.
        Parameters:
        maze - a Maze instance
        Returns:
        the cells in the maze whose distance to the exit is 1

      • arrayString2d

        protected static java.lang.String arrayString2d(java.lang.Object array)
        Convenience method for representing array as line-separated rows.
        Parameters:
        array - an array
        Returns:
        string representation of the array.

      • testEveryCellHasExit

        public void testEveryCellHasExit()
        Verify that every cell has a path to the exit; calls _testAllCellsConnected(Maze).

      • _testAllCellsConnected

        protected boolean _testAllCellsConnected(Maze maze)
        Verify that every cell has a path to the exit by verifying that for every cell c, there is at least one neighbor n of c that satisfies:
        • |distance(c) - distance(n)|=1
        • c and n are not separated by a wallboard.
        ***Expected result: all cells satisfy the above conditions. This method returns false immediately if an erroneous cell is found. (Though this option should be unreachable, as the maze generation process short-circuits by failing to calculate distances in the event that a maze has closed rooms).
        Parameters:
        maze - a maze created by a MazeBuilder instance
        Returns:
        boolean for whether the test is successful

      • testMaxDistanceStartingPoint

        public void testMaxDistanceStartingPoint()
        Tests that the maze's starting cell (as returned by Maze.getMazedists().getStartPosition()) has a distance that coincides with the maximal value in that matrix. ***Expected result: maximal distance in the maze is observed at the starting cell.

      • testNoRoomsInPerfectMaze

        public void testNoRoomsInPerfectMaze()
        Test that there are no rooms in a perfect maze. Calls _testNoRoomsInPerfectMaze().

      • _testNoRoomsInPerfectMaze

        public boolean _testNoRoomsInPerfectMaze()
        Iterates over every cell in a perfect maze and confirms that the cell is not in a room (uses Floorplan.isInRoom(int x, int y)). If any cell in a room is found, immediately returns false. Otherwise, once all cells are exhausted, return true. ***Expected result: return true, no cells in rooms.
        Returns:
        boolean for whether the test is successful

      • getMaze

        public Maze getMaze(boolean perfect,
                    boolean deterministic,
                    int level)
        Sets things in order for a maze to be generated. OrderStub, Controller, and MazeBuilder instances receive the parameters required to initialize the maze. Ensures that the maze is finished generating before tests are performed.
        Parameters:
        perfect - boolean:{maze is perfect}
        deterministic - boolean:{maze is generated deterministically}
        level - level of the maze
        Returns:
        the generated Maze instance
